__comment__: This file was automatically created by mcresources
name: Crops

pages.text: Crops are a source of food and some other materials. While each crop is slightly different, crops all have some similar principles. In order to start growing crops, you will need some $(thing)Seeds$(), which can be obtained by searching for $(l:the_world/wild_crops)Wild Crops$(), and breaking them.$(br2)Once you have obtained seeds, you will also need a $(thing)Hoe$().
In the stone age, a Hoe can be $(thing)knapped$() as seen above.

Once the hoe head is knapped, it can be crafted into a Hoe.$(br2)Hoes function as in Vanilla, by right clicking dirt blocks to turn them into $(thing)Farmland$(). They can also be used to create $(thing)Path Blocks$(), and convert $(thing)Rooted Dirt$() into $(thing)Dirt$().
All crops need to be planted on farmland in order to grow. Some crops have additional requirements such as being waterlogged, or requiring a stick to grow on.
Crops do not need $(thing)nutrients$() to grow, but they certainly help. There are three nutrients: $(b)Nitrogen$(), $(6)Phosphorous$(), and $(d)Potassium$(). Each crop has a favorite nutrient.

Consuming its favorite nutrient causes a crop to grow faster, and improves the yield of the crop at harvest time. That means that crops that consumed more nutrients drop more food when broken! Consuming a nutrient also has the effect of replenishing the other nutrients around it a small amount.

pages.title: Fertilizer
pages.text: To add nutrients to soil, try a $(l:mechanics/fertilizers)Fertilizer$(). See that page for more information on how they work and how to get them.

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 25 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#hydration)Hydration$(): 40 - 100 %$(br)$(bold)Nutrient$(): Nitrogen$(br2)Barley is a single block crop. Barley seeds can be planted on farmland to be grown, and will produce $(thing)Barley$() and $(thing)Barley Seeds$() as a product.
pages.title: Barley

pages.text: $(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 25 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#hydration)Hydration$(): 40 - 100 %$(br)$(bold)Nutrient$(): Nitrogen$(br2)Oat is a single block crop. Oat seeds can be planted on farmland to be grown, and will produce $(thing)Oat$() and $(thing)Oat Seeds$() as a product.
pages.title: Oat

pages.text: $(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 25 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#hydration)Hydration$(): 40 - 100 %$(br)$(bold)Nutrient$(): Nitrogen$(br2)Rye is a single block crop. Rye seeds can be planted on farmland to be grown, and will produce $(thing)Rye$() and $(thing)Rye Seeds$() as a product.
pages.title: Rye

pages.text: $(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 25 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#hydration)Hydration$(): 40 - 100 %$(br)$(bold)Nutrient$(): Nitrogen$(br2)Maize is a two block tall crop. Maize seeds can be planted on farmland to be grown, will grow two blocks tall, and will produce $(thing)Maize$() and $(thing)Maize Seeds$() as a product.
pages.title: Maize

pages.text: $(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 25 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#hydration)Hydration$(): 40 - 100 %$(br)$(bold)Nutrient$(): Nitrogen$(br2)Wheat is a single block crop. Wheat seeds can be planted on farmland to be grown, and will produce $(thing)Wheat$() and $(thing)Wheat Seeds$() as a product.
pages.title: Wheat

pages.text: $(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 25 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#hydration)Hydration$(): 40 - 100 %$(br)$(bold)Nutrient$(): Nitrogen$(br2)Rice is a single block crop. Rice must be grown underwater - it must be planted on farmland, in freshwater that is a single block deep. It will produce $(thing)Rice$() and $(thing)Rice Seeds$() as a product.
pages.title: Rice

pages.text: Note: in order to grow, the rice block must be $(thing)Waterlogged$().

$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 25 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#hydration)Hydration$(): 40 - 100 %$(br)$(bold)Nutrient$(): Nitrogen$(br2)Beets area a single block crop. Beet seeds can be planted on farmland to be grown, and will produce $(thing)Beet$() and $(thing)Beet Seeds$() as a product.
pages.title: Beet

pages.text: $(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 25 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#hydration)Hydration$(): 40 - 100 %$(br)$(bold)Nutrient$(): Nitrogen$(br2)Green Beans is a climbing two block tall crop. Green Bean seeds can be planted on farmland to be grown, will grow two blocks tall if a stick is present, and will produce $(thing)Green Beans$() and $(thing)Green Bean Seeds$() as a product.
pages.title: Green Beans

pages.text: The stick is required in order for the crop to fully grow.

pages.text: $(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#temperature)Temperature$(): 5 - 25 °C$(br)$(bold)$(l:the_world/climate#hydration)Hydration$(): 40 - 100 %$(br)$(bold)Nutrient$(): Nitrogen$(br2)Sugarcane is a two block tall crop. Sugarcane seeds can be planted on farmland to be grown, will grow two blocks tall, and will produce $(thing)Sugarcane$() and $(thing)Sugarcane Seeds$() as a product. Sugarcane can be used to make $(thing)Sugar$().
